clinical_study.brief_title: Home Telemonitoring in Patients at High Risk for Readmission
clinical_study.official_title: Home Telemonitoring in Patients at High Risk for Readmission

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy of home telemonitoring as an intervention to decrease hospital readmissions in patients at high risk for readmission. The overall readmission rate for high-risk MCF hospital patients is approximately 20%. Currently a system is in place to identify and score all MCF patients for their risk of readmission. This score is based on multiple variables including but not limited to: co-morbid conditions, patient's health literacy, whether they are a Medicare/Medicaid patient, their in-home social support, and whether they have had prior hospital admissions within the previous year. The literature shows that home telemonitoring of patients has had mixed results for effectiveness at preventing hospitalizations and emergency department visits. Many of these reports have restricted studies to patients with specific diseases or general characteristics; some have shown improved results while others have not. No study has examined patients who are high risk for readmission to determine if home telemonitoring for 30 days post-discharge reduces the risk for 30-day readmission.

primary_outcome.description: Compare 30-day readmission rates between high-risk patients who are home monitored using technology and high-risk patients who receive the current standard care.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Readmissions in the Emergency Room
secondary_outcome.description: Compare 30-day emergency department visit rates between high-risk patients who are home monitored using technology and high-risk patients who receive current standard care.

arm_group.description: patients will receive standard of care discharge instructions
patients will be discharged with a telemonitoring device for 30 days

intervention.description: patients will be provided with a philips home telemonitoring system post hospital discharge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1) readmission risk score of 11 or higher 2) may be from any service in the hospital 3) patient discharged home or 4) patient discharged to one of the five most commonly used skilled nursing/rehabilitation facilities by MCF (Brooks Rehab, Cypress Village, Life Care Center of Jacksonville, Avante Village at Jacksonville Beach, River Garden)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. international
2. under age 18
3. discharged to hospice
4. discharged to a sub-acute care hospital
5. transferred to an acute care hospital or
6. transferred to a skilled facility other than the five listed above.
7. if the patient has a planned readmission within the next 30 days
